column4: avallach: you could try reconfiguring the X server, that worked for me.
do you mean by editing the xorg.conf?  thats what im trying.  im afraid im a bit of a novice (only slightly better than newb)
insted of manually editing it, you can try 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg' console based tool for editing it
...at 1280x1024 it only gave me the option for 60hz for some reason.
